{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3324245,"name":"Caleb Marshall","username":"N0tACyb0rg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/n0tacyb0rg/{size}/218596_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-05T05:50:51.023Z","cooked":"

Code here: DriveSubsystem.java
I am trying to set the conversion factor on our drivetrain motors’ RelativeEncoder’s to our drive gear ratio of 12:72 (plus the 6in wheel circumference). When doing so through, for example, frontLeftEncoder.setPositionConversionFactor(DrivetrainConstants.kEncoderDistanceConversionFactor), or doing frontLeftEncoder.getPosition() * DrivetrainConstants.kEncoderDistanceConversionFactor in my method to get the wheel positions, the odometry on the robot no longer updates it’s position, but still updates the heading.

When I leave the conversion factor as the default and only call frontLeftEncoder.getPosition(), the odometry does update as expected, just with a much larger scale than intended, which does not work correctly with our PathPlanner-based autonomous routines.

How can I correctly set the conversion factor for the motors?

Dependency Information

  • WPILib: v2024.3.1
  • REVLib: v2024.2.3

Would you be able to provide your code for the conversion factor in DrivetrainConstants?

My first assumption would be that it is doing integer division (ie 12/72 in Java would evaluate to 0 because both of those are integers, while 12.0/72 (or 12.0/72.0, 12/72.0, (double) 12/72, etc) would result in ~0.167). This could be a cause for it not updating position odometry as it would constantly think the position is zero.
